intro: Platylobium formosum var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
